metadata.title: CVE-2019-0201 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue is present in Apache ZooKeeper 1.0.0 to 3.4.13 and 3.5.0-alpha to3.5.4-beta. ZooKeeper’s getACL() command doesn’t check any permission whenretrieves the ACLs of the requested node and returns all informationcontained in the ACL Id field as plaintext string.DigestAuthenticationProvider overloads the Id field with the hash valuethat is used for user authentication. As a consequence, if DigestAuthentication is in use, the unsalted hash value will be disclosed bygetACL() request for unauthenticated or unprivileged users.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzookeeper-java - 3.4.13-3
libzookeeper-mt2 - 3.4.13-3
libzookeeper-st2 - 3.4.13-3
python3-zookeeper - 3.4.13-3
zookeeper - 3.4.13-3
zookeeper-bin - 3.4.13-3
zookeeperd - 3.4.13-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zookeeper package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.13-3').
